column1: Topic title: Don t use DAP as an excuse to cling on to Selangor

column8: text

http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...-selangor-exco/The StarMonday, 15 May 2017 | MYT 5:33 PMDon't use DAP as an excuse to cling on to Selangor exco posts, PAS toldby ashley tangPETALING JAYA: Yeo Bee Yin wants PAS to stop using DAP as an excuse to cling on to the three exco posts in the Selangor government.The Damansara Utama assemblyman said they were "puzzled" by Selangor PAS commissioner Ustaz Sallehen Mukhyi's explanation that PAS would remain in the state government to prevent "mischief" by DAP.Yeo said despite the years of working together in the state government, Selangor PAS was making DAP a "punching bag" for decisions that the Islamist party made themselves.Yeo also questioned the ethics and principles of the Islamist party.She also said that PAS, which claims they are remaining in the Selangor government to honour the people's mandate, had forgotten that the people's mandate was for PAS to be part of the Pakatan Harapan government."PAS did not only betray the common policy framework of Pakatan, they cut ties with not one but both of their former partners in Pakatan," she said.Yeo also said that Sallehen's excuse did not make sense as DAP does not need PAS to remain in the state government "to do the right thing for the people of Selangor".She further questioned the real reason PAS was clinging on to the exco positions."Is it to continue to use state government resources to strengthen their party support in Selangor and eventually turn their back against us in the coming general election?" she asked."If Selangor PAS has the slightest honour and still remember the partnership and friendship we once had, then we call upon them to stop blaming DAP for the decision they made and do the most honourable thing of owning up to the decision to cut ties with PKR."Selangor PAS cannot have its cake and eat it too," she said.Selangor Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Azmin Ali was reported to have asked the three PAS members - Datuk Iskandar Samad, Datuk Dr Ahmad Yunus Hairi dan Zaidy Abdul Talib - to resign from the state executive council.The decision was made following the PAS Syura Council's decision last Thursday to end the party's political cooperation with PKR.Azmin, however, assured the three exco members that PAS could still remain as part of the state government in line with the mandate of the 2013 General Election.
